function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Unused car parking spaces being repurposed for different activities could increase the risk of contagious disease transmission if proper precautions are not taken.","Impact":"Increased risk of disease transmission leading to potential outbreaks or spread of illness within the built environment.","Mitigation":"Implement strict hygiene and sanitation measures, promote air circulation, and enforce social distancing protocols in repurposed spaces.","Technologies":"Air purifiers, UV-C disinfection systems, touchless fixtures, and smart ventilation systems can help mitigate the risk.","People":"Students, staff, visitors, and occupants of the repurposed spaces are at risk.","Owner":"Building developer, university administration, and facility management."},{"Description":"Conversion of car parking areas into an open space market during red level situations could lead to crowding and close contact among individuals, increasing the risk of disease transmission.","Impact":"Higher likelihood of disease spread due to crowding, close contact, and potential disregard for social distancing measures in the market area.","Mitigation":"Enforce crowd control measures, limit the number of vendors and visitors, and monitor adherence to social distancing guidelines in the market area.","Technologies":"Mobile crowd monitoring systems, contactless payment solutions, and virtual queuing applications can help manage the risk.","People":"Market vendors, shoppers, and surrounding community members are at risk.","Owner":"University administration and market organizers."},{"Description":"Inadequate ventilation and temperature control in repurposed educational spaces could contribute to the spread of airborne pathogens and discomfort for occupants.","Impact":"Poor indoor air quality, increased risk of airborne disease transmission, and reduced occupant comfort and well-being.","Mitigation":"Install high-efficiency HVAC systems, air quality sensors, and outdoor air ventilation systems to improve indoor air quality and regulate temperature.","Technologies":"Energy recovery ventilators, CO2 monitoring systems, and smart HVAC controls can be utilized for better ventilation and temperature control.","People":"Students, faculty, and staff using the repurposed educational spaces are at risk.","Owner":"University administration and facility management."}]}
